Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Out: Know Latest GMP, How To Check Allotment Status Online - News18
summary:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Out: Latest GMP and How to Check Allotment Status

Last Updated: December 17, 2024, 06:56 IST

The Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment has been finalized, with investors receiving bank debit messages. The latest GMP stands at 24.36%, indicating a decent listing gain for investors.

  • IPO opened for subscription from December 11 to December 13 and was subscribed 28.75 times.
  • Retail investors subscribed 2.43 times, NII 15.01 times, and QIB 85.11 times.
  • The IPO price band was set at Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share.
  • Vishal Mega Mart's unlisted shares are currently trading at Rs 98.5 in the grey market.
  • The listing is scheduled for December 18 on BSE and NSE.
“The Vishal Mega Mart IPO has generated significant buzz with its robust subscription numbers and decent GMP.”

Investors can check their allotment status on BSE and NSE websites or Kfin Technologies’ portal.

This IPO reflects strong investor interest and confidence in the retail market.
newTitle: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Out: Latest GMP and How to Check Allotment Status

title: GST Council May Slash Tax On Online Food Delivery Charges To 5%: Report - News18
summary:
GST Council May Slash Tax On Online Food Delivery Charges To 5%: Report

Last Updated: December 17, 2024, 05:17 IST

The GST Council is considering reducing the goods and services tax (GST) on food delivery charges by e-commerce operators from 18% to 5%, if approved by the Finance Minister-led council, the revised tax rate could come into effect starting January 1, 2022.

  • Current tax rate for online food delivery charges is 18%.
  • Proposed reduction could lower this to 5%.
  • Food delivery platforms like Zomato and Swiggy would not be eligible for input tax credits under the new proposal.
  • This proposal comes amid increased scrutiny from tax authorities.
“Recently, the tax department directed Zomato to pay Rs 803.4 crore in taxes and fines for non-payment of certain taxes during the period from 2019 to 2022.”

This potential change aims to alleviate the financial burden on consumers and is a response to heightened scrutiny on food delivery platforms.
newTitle: GST Council May Slash Tax On Online Food Delivery Charges To 5%: Report

India's solar energy agency changes bidding policy after Adani bribery allegations: Report - The Economic Times
summary:
India's Solar Energy Agency Adjusts Bidding Policy Following Adani Bribery Claims

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date]

Source: [Insert Source]

An Indian government agency responsible for promoting renewable energy has altered its bidding practices to mitigate corruption risks following U.S. bribery allegations against the Adani Group.

  • The Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) is changing how it issues power tenders.
  • The changes come after U.S. allegations of bribery involving Adani Group in tender processes.
  • SECI will base around 75% of its new bids on specific state demand, instead of primarily seeking suppliers first.
  • Previous bidding practices, accounting for about 90% of total bids, heightened corruption risks.
  • Despite the allegations against Adani, SECI has found no basis for investigations.
  • There are concerns these allegations could hinder foreign investments in India’s renewable sector.
  • SECI set a target to bid for 15 gigawatts (GW) of power this fiscal year, but achieved only 6-7 GW so far.
The allegations against the Adani Group could temporarily cut foreign investments in India's renewable sector.

In conclusion, SECI's adjustments to its bidding policy are a direct response to concerns over corruption amidst serious allegations, indicating a significant shift in how renewable energy projects may be approached in India.
newTitle: India's Solar Energy Agency Adjusts Bidding Policy Following Adani Bribery Claims

title: Cell manufacturing, growing domestic orders augur well for Waaree Energies - The Economic Times
summary:
Cell manufacturing, growing domestic orders augur well for Waaree Energies

Publication Date: November 6, 2024 Source: Economic Times

Waaree Energies, India's largest solar panel maker, faces challenges with a 14% stock price decline due to concerns over US policy changes, despite its confidence in growth, particularly in cell manufacturing.

  • Waaree's stock has declined since November 6, with 72% of its order book dependent on the US market.
  • The company aims to enhance profitability through new cell manufacturing.
  • Revenue from exports is increasing significantly.
  • Plans for expanding module and cell capacity in the upcoming years.
  • Concerns regarding falling realization rates in both US and Indian markets.
“The company stated that its operations are tariff agnostic.”

In conclusion, while Waaree Energies is focused on expansion and enhancing profitability, overall market performance remains cautious due to external factors.

summary:
MicroStrategy Announces Enormous Bitcoin Purchase Following Nasdaq-100 Inclusion

Publication Date: December 2023, Source: U.Today

MicroStrategy has made headlines by purchasing $1.5 billion worth of Bitcoin, marking a significant investment in the cryptocurrency following its inclusion in the Nasdaq-100.

  • MicroStrategy purchased $1.54 billion in Bitcoin, pushing its total holdings to 439,000 BTC worth approximately $46.5 billion.
  • The average price for the new Bitcoin purchases was $100,386, indicating a notable climb into six-figure prices.
  • Share prices for MicroStrategy rose more than 3.5% in pre-market trading after the Nasdaq-100 announcement.
  • Bitcoin reached a new all-time high of $106,352 as per CoinGecko data.
“Every time Manhattan real estate goes up in value, they [developers] issue more debt to develop real estate. That's why your buildings are so tall in New York City.” - Michael Saylor

This investment continues MicroStrategy's strategy of accumulating Bitcoin as a long-term asset and emphasizes its growing confidence in cryptocurrency markets.

How ARM (ARM) And Qualcomm (QCOM) Can Turn A Courtroom Battle Into Mutual Success - Yahoo Finance
summary:
How ARM (ARM) And Qualcomm (QCOM) Can Turn A Courtroom Battle Into Mutual Success

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Financial News

ARM Holdings and Qualcomm are involved in a complicated legal dispute regarding intellectual property rights, triggered by Qualcomm's acquisition of a startup that held ARM’s technology licenses. This case is crucial for both companies as it impacts their revenues and technological capabilities.

  • The two companies have been in a legal battle for two years over licensing agreements.
  • Qualcomm's acquisition of Nuvia was strategic, despite complications regarding ARM licenses.
  • ARM risks losing 11% of its revenue if its licensing deal with Qualcomm is canceled.
  • Qualcomm's chip production relies heavily on the ARM licensing for its AI laptops and Snapdragon chips.
  • The most favorable outcome for ARM would be to win the case and renegotiate the licensing deal for better terms.
  • For Qualcomm, maintaining access to ARM technology is crucial, even if it comes at a higher cost.
“This also poses a big risk for ARM, which is why we believe a settlement is likely soon.”

The ongoing legal situation highlights the interdependence of ARM and Qualcomm, with potential paths towards resolution that could benefit both companies.
newTitle: How ARM and Qualcomm Can Find Mutual Success Despite Legal Battles
